name: 2-phenylimidazole
Reason: 2-phenylimidazole has a melting point that we can compare to benzene's melting point of 5.5°C. The basic unit for this compound can be considered the imidazole ring, which has a melting point of around 10°C due to its rigidity and pi-pi interactions. The phenyl group (c1ccc(cc1)c2) adds approximately +30°C due to increasing molecular weight and rigidity. The imidazole ring itself has a melting point of around 10°C due to its rigidity and pi-pi interactions. The phenyl group also adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +30°C.
